channel.title: danielhonderd – Daniel's Adventures
channel.description: A semester abroad in the University of Florida

item.title: Week 10: Devil’s Den
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: There are a lot of springs near Gainesville, so it would be a shame not to go to any. Two friends and I made plans to go to Devil’s Den. This place is an underwater cave with scuba-diving options. But we rented snorkeling equipment instead, it was such a beautiful experience! It was also captivating … Continue reading Week 10: Devil’s Den →

item.title: Week 9: Haunted house
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: Homecoming is finally here, but I’m nowhere to be found in the Swamp stadium, what happened? First of all, I have been to all other games, and no I was not sick during this one. Truth to be told, I sold my ticket for this game because I would get most of my investment (the … Continue reading Week 9: Haunted house →

item.title: Week 8: Homecoming Parade
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: This game was one I knew was going to be one of the most boring ones. The game against Towson had a 97% chance of winning on the ESPN site. It was fun nonetheless, and I met some amazing people before the game started. And they had an amazing half-time show with fire!! I was … Continue reading Week 8: Homecoming Parade →

item.title: Week 7: Blog upgrade!
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: Saturday, gameday, we have a homegame against Tennessee and the outrageous amount of commuters already started moving two days ago. Since the game starts at noon, tailgating started for some at 7 in the morning. Something that I cannot do so they can start without me. The game was not all too interesting to watch … Continue reading Week 7: Blog upgrade! →

item.title: Tips for upcoming exchange students to Florida
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: In case someone might search for student exchange stories about UF, and stumble upon this site, I’ll prove a list of tips to help you. Always go for on-campus residence, it will be less luxurious than off-campus and you will probably share a room, meaning less privacy. But off-campus (international Weaver Hall for us, try … Continue reading Tips for upcoming exchange students to Florida →

item.title: Week 6: St. Augustine and froyo!
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: On Saturday, we went on a trip with the Navigators to St. Augustine, a very beautiful place as you will see in the pictures. Since it is/was a harbor, we also made use of the beach at the ocean (for me the first time since I’ve been in Florida). It was fun to meet other … Continue reading Week 6: St. Augustine and froyo! →

item.title: Week 5: Football game at UF
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: It’s Saturday, and it’s the day of the first football game at campus. It’s the Gators against UT Martin. What to do on this day? First I will need to buy an orange shirt that will combine well with the blue bandana that my mentor gave me for the game. I already have an orange … Continue reading Week 5: Football game at UF →

item.title: Week 4: Survival
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: Surviving at UF is no easy task. For groceries, I’ve tried going to Aldi by bus, which takes very long. I also tried going to the same Aldi by bike, which is perfectly doable, except for the way back… All food turns brown really quickly because of the humidity (bananas turn from green to brown … Continue reading Week 4: Survival →

item.title: Week 3: Dorian knocking on the door?
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: On Sunday, an international food truck market was being held. Problem was, that the location would be at a walking distance of 45 minutes… The solution for me, and compromise for Gina (mentor), was going by bike. However, with Gina on the back of mine, something that was unimaginable for her. While everything went okay, … Continue reading Week 3: Dorian knocking on the door? →

item.title: Week 2: Frats and the Navigators
item.dc:creator: danielhonderd
item.description: Frat parties, a quick information guide about them can be found on Blue Mountain State on Netflix. I decided to attempt to get into one with my German floormember Leo. Our plan was simple, buy a six-pack of beer and use that as a bribe to get into the party. The six-pack became a 12-pack … Continue reading Week 2: Frats and the Navigators →
